name: Riparian Wood Recruitment
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Near-channel forest supplies future wood; most recruitment comes from within about 20-30 m of banks.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map width and continuity of mature trees within ~30 m of each bank using imagery and field checks; note canopy gaps and downed trees.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: No meaningful near-channel forest where forest is natural.
Criteria: Grass/crops/development to top of bank; minimal recruitment.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Narrow (<15 m) or patchy trees with frequent breaks.
Criteria: Few large stems near channel.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: 15-30 m forested buffer with gaps or one bank narrower.
Criteria: Partial coverage; recruitment reduced.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Continuous >=30 m mature forest on both banks.
Criteria: Strong recruitment potential within ~30 m corridor.
